channel.title: [Gamemode idea] Burocracy
channel.description:
The idea is that the conversions are triggered by BD rather than Unseen. If I try to explain it like this no one will think this would work so I'ma just show the relevant class cards. Starting with the BD converter. This is instead of the sheriff:
> # [color = "steblue"] Magistrate [/color] :shield: :crossed_swords: > **[color = "steblue"] Blue Dragon Investigative [/color]** > Passive 1: Greed - You must use your Night Ability every night. If you don't then your target will be selected by RNG and won't be told to you. > Passive 2: Stand in - If you would be occupied then you instead target a random target. You don't know who if this happens. > > Night Ability: Search and Sieze - Learn if target player is a member of the Unseen. If they are not then they will be converted if possible. (Unlimited)
> # [color = "purple"] Mastermind [/color] :shield: :crossed_swords: > **[color = "purple"] Unseen Special [/color]** > Passive 1: Immune to death. Immune to Occupy and Redirect. Anyone who tries will think they succeeded. > Passive 2: Keeping Tabs - You appear to be BD. You know who the Magistrate is and what his night results are. > > Day Ability: Successor - Target player will become the Magistrate if they are convertable and the current one dies. > > Night Ability 1: Foresight - Learn target players converted class. (4 uses) > Night Ability 2: Manipulate - Redirect the Magistrate to target player. He will not be informed. (3 uses)
The Unseen will have the member limited upped to 4

item.title: [Gamemode idea] Burocracy
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Probably. I’d need to work out some kinks first. For example Manipulate might need to have less uses.

Read full topic

So

Are you going to do this idea

Read full topic

item.title: [Gamemode idea] Burocracy
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Solic:

What about Prince meta, where Magistrate exclusively targets day 1 outed Prince? That means the normally unlimited amount of conversion attempts the MM has, is now lowered to 4. I do not see why this ability should be limited in the first place. I assume this version also means the unseen can convert every night as opposed to the Cooldown version ingame?

First of all in FoL Prince meta is even more impractical than in ToL. This is because there are no whispers and there are even more ways to bypass protection in addition to it being rarer in the first place.

Second of all it would be pretty simple for the MM to use Foresight to find a Butler, Convert him, and then use the Butler to trigger stand in.

Manipulate is limited because the Magistrate would be pointless if his target was completely meaningless.

Yes this means no convert cooldown.

Read full topic

item.title: [Gamemode idea] Burocracy
item.dc:creator: Firekitten
item.description:
Well then the magistrate can’t find unseen

And then it goes to the RNGEUS

Read full topic

item.title: [Gamemode idea] Burocracy
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Audreyaloy:

but a point I dislike is successor. and 4 unseen limit, just too op the magistrate is not a super good member of the BD, its easy to manipulate, so if the magistrate and a drunk become the new magistrate, it is like the BD lost a Drunk…

Otherwise what’s to stop the BD from.just hanging the Magistrate D2?

Read full topic

item.title: [Gamemode idea] Burocracy
item.dc:creator: Audreyaloy
item.description:
Its not uninteressing, the Magistrate is like a Sheriff, who is easily manipulated by the mastermind. Its possible he will convert his targets, but the mastermind can also simply change his target its like a burden the BD must carry in order to win.

Edit : Just some notes on the idea

THe Magistrate Cannot be converted, since he cannot convert himself.
Misdirect exist mainly to prevent the magistrate from simply outting all unseen converts, which he could, but since he does not always known who he is converting, that’s keep in check and that’s abilitity is needed.

but a point I dislike is successor. and 4 unseen limit, just too op the magistrate is not a super good member of the BD, its easy to manipulate, so if the magistrate and a drunk become the new magistrate, it is like the BD lost a Drunk…

Read full topic

item.title: [Gamemode idea] Burocracy
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Barrier prevents negative effects from being used on the target. Mislead IS a negative effect, however it isn’t being used on the Magistrate. Worst case scenario more classes need to be changed for this to work. As long as the premise isn’t fundimentally flawed we are good.

Read full topic

item.title: [Gamemode idea] Burocracy
item.dc:creator: Solic
item.description:
But the MM can switch the target to the Magistrate himself right? It will be the unseen’s decision to attempt to convert the Magistrate. This will keep the BD wondering about the alignment of the Magistrate, instead of being 100% confirmed almost. Just add that Successor cannot be used if the unseen’s variant of the Magistrate is alive.

Read full topic
